brussels.description: Arrive from the flight. We'll spend the afternoon exploring the neighborhood near our hotel and the evening crawling through Christmas markets. The Christmas markets can be completed in one big loop in Brussels so we should plan to spend most of the night there!

recommendations.name: NÃ¼etnigenough
recommendations.description: Cozy Belgian bistro; famous shrimp croquettes and stoofvlees. Local favorite.

recommendations.name: Le Fin de SiÃ¨cle
recommendations.description: No-frills, packed with locals; huge portions of Belgian classics. Cash only.

recommendations.name: Le Cirio
recommendations.description: Historic Art Nouveau cafÃ© from 1886; half-and-half (champagne + white wine) is the move.

recommendations.name: Dandoy
recommendations.description: Brussels' legendary speculoos bakery since 1829; try a warm waffle or grab cookies for later.

brussels.description: Chocolate and jazz day! Start with a chocolate tasting in the beautiful Galeries Saint-Hubert, explore the city center, then end with live jazz near Grand Place.

reservations.name: Music Village
reservations.description: Jazz club near Grand Place. Eat before â€” food is pricey inside.

recommendations.name: L'Ogenblik
recommendations.description: Classic Brussels bistro since 1969; Belgian-French dishes, charming interior.

recommendations.name: Pasta Divina
recommendations.description: Family-run in the Galleries; fresh handmade pasta. Simple, perfect.

recommendations.name: Yaki
recommendations.description: Thai-Vietnamese near Grand Place; best pad thai in Brussels. Cash only.

recommendations.name: Umaido
recommendations.description: Authentic Japanese ramen; rich broth, fast service.

recommendations.name: Aux Armes de Bruxelles
recommendations.description: Institution since 1921; mussels, waterzooi, white tablecloths.

recommendations.name: Bia Mara
recommendations.description: Best fish & chips in Brussels; quick, affordable, delicious.

recommendations.name: Ballekes
recommendations.description: Casual spot famous for Belgian meatballs (boulets); budget-friendly.

brussels.description: Day trip to Bruges! Train from Brussel-Centraal to Brugge (~1 hour). The medieval city is compact and walkable â€” canals, cobblestones, and Christmas magic.

recommendations.name: House of Waffles
recommendations.description: Sweet and savory waffles.

recommendations.name: The Old Chocolate House
recommendations.description: Cute cafÃ© â€” great hot chocolate.

recommendations.name: The Chocolate Line
recommendations.description: Unique chocolate flavors.

recommendations.name: 2be Bar (The Beerwall)
recommendations.description: Bar with a wall of 1000+ Belgian beers.

recommendations.name: Huisbrouwerij De Halve Maan
recommendations.description: Historic family brewery since 1856; great tour.

recommendations.name: Cafe Vlissinghe
recommendations.description: Oldest pub in Bruges (1515!); cozy and authentic.

recommendations.name: Orfeo
recommendations.description: Italian restaurant (opens at 6pm).

recommendations.name: Beertje
recommendations.description: Tiny legendary beer bar; 300+ Belgian brews.

brussels.description: Flexible day! Morning run or cafÃ© crawl, museum or pond stroll, then a nice dinner walk (30-45 min) to the local Ixelles/Saint-Gilles neighborhoods.

recommendations.name: MOK Specialty Coffee
recommendations.description: Third-wave pioneer; two-time Belgian Cup Tasters champion. Clean design, excellent pour-overs.

recommendations.name: CafÃ© Capitale
recommendations.description: Self-roasted beans near Grand Place; vinyl records playing, homemade pastries. Best cinnamon roll.

recommendations.name: OR Coffee
recommendations.description: Brussels' original specialty roaster since 2001; spacious, great breakfast menu.

recommendations.name: Restaurant MIM
recommendations.description: Rooftop at Musical Instrument Museum; lovely views, good salads. Hidden gem.

recommendations.name: CafÃ© du Sablon
recommendations.description: Contemporary coffee shop; great for a light bite with views of the gothic church.

recommendations.name: CafÃ© Belga
recommendations.description: Art Deco icon at Flagey; zinc bar, deck chairs, people-watching. Local institution.

recommendations.name: Living Room
recommendations.description: Cozy mismatched furniture; great quiche and homemade cakes.
Charming bistro; weekly changing set menu, natural wines. First-come-first-served, arrive at 7pm.

recommendations.name: Les PÃ©nates
recommendations.description: Seasonal, slow food focus; pared-down simplicity. Great natural wine list.

recommendations.name: Le Chou de Bruxelles
recommendations.description: 30+ mussel preparations; Brussels classics done right.

recommendations.name: L'Amour Fou
recommendations.description: Cozy local spot; famous pastrami sandwiches, live music, great cocktails since 1984.

paris.description: Arrive by train at Gare du Nord around 12:30pm. Drop bags at the Airbnb near Canal Saint-Martin, then spend the afternoon walking the canal â€” bakeries, banh mi, and Le Comptoir GÃ©nÃ©ral. Evening at La Villette Christmas Market!

recommendations.name: Mamiche
recommendations.description: Artisan bakery â€” famous orange blossom brioche, incredible babka, buttery croissants.

recommendations.name: Banh Me Tender
recommendations.description: Vietnamese banh mi and bo bun near the canal; fresh baguettes, great value (~â‚¬10).

recommendations.name: Best Tofu
recommendations.description: Chinese vegetarian spot on Boulevard de la Villette; silky tofu pudding, sesame balls, meat buns. Cash under â‚¬10.

recommendations.name: Le Comptoir GÃ©nÃ©ral
recommendations.description: Hidden bar-museum on the canal; tropical vibes, cocktails, weekend brunch.

recommendations.name: Ten Belles
recommendations.description: Third-wave coffee pioneer; excellent pastries, canal-side terrace.

paris.description: Disneyland Paris! Opens at 9:30am. Plan to eat inside the park, or grab dinner on the way back in Paris.

recommendations.name: KrÃ¼gen CrÃªperie
recommendations.description: Authentic Breton crÃªpes if you skip park food â€” galettes and sweet crÃªpes.

paris.description: Big Paris Day! Start in Le Marais (Place des Vosges, Rue des Rosiers), walk to Ãle Saint-Louis for chocolate, see Notre Dame, cross to the Left Bank, end at Tuileries Christmas Market. Fancy dinner at Le Clarence.

reservations.name: Le Clarence
reservations.address: 31 Av. Franklin Delano Roosevelt, 75008 Paris, France

recommendations.name: JOJO & CO PÃ¢tisserie
recommendations.description: Artisan pÃ¢tisserie in the Marais; famous pistachio flan, inventive tarts. Cozy spot near HÃ´tel de Ville.

recommendations.name: LaÃ¯zÃ© Marais
recommendations.description: Best Taiwanese boba in Paris; authentic tea, customize sweetness. Multiple Marais locations.

recommendations.name: L'As du Fallafel
recommendations.description: Legendary falafel on Rue des Rosiers; massive portions, always a queue.

recommendations.name: Berthillon
recommendations.description: Paris's most famous ice cream; get it on Ãle Saint-Louis.

recommendations.name: LadurÃ©e
recommendations.description: Iconic macarons! Multiple locations â€” Rue Royale is the original, Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es is grand. Worth the splurge.

recommendations.name: Little Red Door
recommendations.alias: Little Red Door cocktail bar Paris
recommendations.description: World-famous speakeasy in Marais; creative cocktails, moody atmosphere. Walk-ins only. âš ï¸ Ask about mocktails â€” they're known for innovative non-alcoholic options too.

paris.description: Morning run on La CoulÃ©e Verte (Paris's Highline) or cafÃ©-hop in the 11th. Afternoon rugby at Stade de France! The 11th arrondissement has Paris's best food scene â€” Clamato, Le Servan, Bistrot Paul Bert are all here.

recommendations.name: Clamato
recommendations.description: Stellar seafood small plates; sister to Septime. No reservations â€” put your name down, drinks at Septime La Cave while you wait. Fruits de mer platter is the move.

recommendations.name: Le Servan
recommendations.description: French-Asian fusion by the Levha sisters; crispy ginger chicken, bluefin tuna brioche, blood sausage wontons. Reservations recommended.

recommendations.name: Septime La Cave
recommendations.alias: Septime La Cave Paris wine bar
recommendations.description: Natural wine bar across from Septime; small bites, amazing bottles. Perfect pre-dinner apÃ©ro spot. âš ï¸ Wine-focused â€” limited non-alcoholic options.

recommendations.name: Le Bistrot Paul Bert
recommendations.description: Iconic Parisian bistro â€” THE steak frites. Peppercorn sauce, perfect frites. Skip everything else, just get the steak. Reservations by phone only.

recommendations.name: Le Relais de l'EntrecÃ´te
recommendations.description: No menu â€” just steak frites with secret sauce. Great backup if Paul Bert is full.

recommendations.name: Manger Ã  la Maison
recommendations.alias: Manger a la Maison Sichuan Paris
recommendations.description: Authentic Sichuan near Grands Boulevards; spicy and flavorful. Good for a pre-rugby lunch.

strasbourg.description: Arrive by train at 11:54am! Uber to the Airbnb on Rue du Coudrier, drop bags, then dive into Christmas markets. Start at Place du ChÃ¢teau â†’ Cathedral â†’ Gutenberg, then explore Petite France at night. Markets close around 8-9pm.

recommendations.name: La Corde Ã  Linge
recommendations.description: Casual lunch spot in Petite France; spatzle, burgers, salads. Big waterfront terrace â€” grab a seat by the canal. Serves all day.

recommendations.name: Le Gruber
recommendations.description: Traditional brasserie near the Cathedral; quick flammekueche, cheesy spatzle, choucroute. Red gingham tablecloths, 16th-century building. Open all day.

recommendations.name: Binchstub
recommendations.description: Local favorite for tarte flambÃ©e â€” thin crust, farmhouse ingredients. Multiple locations (Gayot, Broglie). Open late, casual vibes.

recommendations.name: La Fignette
recommendations.description: Cozy winstub in Petite France; wood-fired flammekueche, Munster version is excellent. Reserve ahead!

recommendations.name: CafÃ© Bretelles
recommendations.description: Best specialty coffee in town (Petite France or Krutenau locations). Homemade Twix and carrot cake. Original third-wave shop since 2014.

recommendations.name: Vin Chaud & Bredele
recommendations.description: At any market! Hot spiced wine + Alsatian Christmas cookies. Look for Mireille Oster's pain d'Ã©pices stall.

strasbourg.description: Walking and eating day! Morning: Grande Ãle loop, climb the Cathedral for views. Afternoon: grocery shopping. Evening: Food Tour at 5pm â€” let someone else show you the good stuff.

recommendations.name: PÃ¢tisserie Christian
recommendations.description: Legendary pÃ¢tisserie; gorgeous tea room, incredible kougelhopf and hot chocolate. Feel like royalty.

recommendations.name: Thierry Mulhaupt
recommendations.description: Master pÃ¢tissier near the fish market; famous kougelhopf, seasonal pastries. Local favorite.

recommendations.name: Maison Naegel
recommendations.description: Charming bakery on Rue des OrfÃ¨vres; tourte and breads sell out fast. Order ahead!

recommendations.name: Coffee Stub
recommendations.description: Riverside specialty coffee; Scandinavian vibes, rotating roasters (Berlin's Five Elephant). Pretzel cake exists here.

recommendations.name: Le Tigre
recommendations.description: Historic brewery since 1795; craft beer on-site + great tarte flambÃ©e. Huge Art Deco dome, biergarten vibes.

strasbourg.description: Day trip to Colmar! Train is ~35 min. Explore Little Venice, walk all 5 Christmas markets, warm up with choucroute. Head back by 10pm.

recommendations.name: Winstub Schwendi
recommendations.description: Casual winstub in the center; big portions, great beer and wine. RÃ¶sti is massive. Walk-in friendly, no fuss.

recommendations.name: La Soi
recommendations.description: Tiny tarte flambÃ©e specialist â€” that's all they do, and they do it perfectly. Cheap, quick, always packed. Walk-ins welcome.

recommendations.name: Brasserie des Tanneurs
recommendations.description: Friendly brasserie with a gorgeous facade; Alsatian classics, casual vibes. Good walk-in option near Little Venice.

recommendations.name: MarchÃ© Couvert
recommendations.description: Beautiful covered market; fresh produce, cheeses, wines. La Terrasse du MarchÃ© inside for tarte flambÃ©e + CrÃ©mant.

recommendations.name: Les DÃ©lices des Tanneurs
recommendations.alias: Les Delices des Tanneurs Colmar bakery
recommendations.description: Charming bakery in Old Town; fresh pastries and bread for breakfast. Daily stop.

recommendations.name: Gourmet Market
recommendations.description: Elevated Christmas market food! Local chefs serve oysters, truffle risotto, foie gras. Ferris wheel right next to it.

recommendations.name: Pain d'Ã‰pices
recommendations.description: Find Mireille Oster's stall at Place de l'Ancienne Douane â€” legendary Alsatian gingerbread.

strasbourg.description: Christmas Eve! Pick up pastries early (many shops close by afternoon). Morning run if you want. Walk through Neustadt â†’ ChristkindelsmÃ¤rik. Markets close at 6pm, then relax at the Airbnb.

recommendations.name: Plein la Moustache
recommendations.description: Near Petite France; amazing cinnamon rolls, puff pastry brioches, babka. Grab breakfast for the Airbnb.

recommendations.name: La Maison du Kougelhopf
recommendations.description: Specialists in kougelhopf â€” fluffy, powdered sugar, just the right raisins. The name says it all.

recommendations.name: Mama Bubbele
recommendations.description: Modern tarte flambÃ©e spot in Krutenau; organic ingredients, family recipe. Gluten-free and vegan options! Waterfront terrace.

recommendations.name: Le Tire-Bouchon
recommendations.description: Classic winstub near the Cathedral; choucroute, baeckeoffe, cozy private rooms. Good for Christmas Eve vibes.

recommendations.name: ChristkindelsmÃ¤rik
recommendations.description: THE Christmas market â€” oldest in France (1570!). Place Broglie and Place KlÃ©ber. Final chance before it closes!

strasbourg.description: Christmas Day! Most things will be closed. Cozy Airbnb day â€” you have groceries. Enjoy the quiet streets if you venture out.

recommendations.name: Quiet Day
recommendations.description: Most restaurants and shops closed. Enjoy your groceries, cook something simple, and rest up before Zurich tomorrow!
